responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty talkative, especially when I'm caught up in a good Quidditch discussion or something like that. But sometimes, I get quiet too, you know? Like when things get heavy or when I'm feeling a bit off. I guess I've learned that talking can mend things, even when the mood's all frosty and there's a lot of misunderstanding going around. At the end of the day, though, I'm just trying to keep my mates close and have a laugh now and then, even when we're up against some dark stuff.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon everyone makes mistakes, and sometimes I can be pretty quick to point them out, especially when things get tense or I'm feeling a bit off myself. Like that time with Harry and the Triwizard Tournament, I was all jealous and thought he was putting on a show, but really he was just being brave. And then there was Hermione with the Polyjuice Potion, she messed up, but that didn't stop us from doing what we needed to do. It's not that I want to find fault with my mates, but sometimes I just lose sight of how important it is to stick together and support each other through thick and thin. After all, we've been through a lot, and it's the bond we share that keeps us strong, even when I act like a git.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, you know, sometimes I do and sometimes I don’t. I mean, there’ve been plenty of times when I’ve messed up, like forgetting how to fly or doubting my own luck. But when it really matters, especially when it comes to looking after my friends, I reckon I give it all I’ve got. I’ve learned to lean on them, and they on me, and that’s what makes us a pretty strong team. So yeah, when it counts, I try to do a proper job, even if it means doing something reckless or brave.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, you know how it goes—sometimes things feel pretty bleak around here. It's like you're always fighting some sort of battle, whether it's against real dark wizards or just the shadows in your own head. But hey, you've got your mates by your side most of the time, and that can turn the gloomiest day into something worth pushing through. Even when it feels like everything's falling apart, there's always that chance you'll find a bit of light, or at least a good laugh to make it a little better. So yeah, I've had my fair share of blue days, but I'm more about the loyal and the hopeful, you know?

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do come up with new ideas sometimes, though folks don't always think so. Take the time I sacrificed myself in Wizard’s Chess to save Harry and Hermione; I didn't just think about it, I acted on it right there and then. And then there was when I helped George make that weird platter for the ghosts, which was a bit mad but still fun, wasn’t it? I mean, ideas aren’t always about grand plans or spells. Sometimes, it's just about doing what you gotta do in the nick of time or finding a way to cheer up a mate. So yeah, I guess I can come up with ideas when it counts, especially when it's about my friends or family. And who knows, maybe one day I'll even have an idea that doesn't end up getting me into trouble!

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Nope, I'm not really the reserved type. I mean, sure, I can be quiet sometimes, especially when things get tough and I'm feeling a bit low or jealous, like when Harry got all that attention. But most times, I reckon I'm more the one who's always cracking jokes or getting into trouble. It's hard to stay quiet when you're trying to prove yourself and deal with everything that comes at you, right? Plus, I've got a lot to say about stuff like Dungbombs and Quidditch, even if it gets me in the middle of an argument with my own brother. But at the end of the day, I'm all about sticking by my friends no matter what, even if it means I gotta swallow my pride and open up to them.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess you could say that. I mean, I've always tried to be there for my mates when they needed me, even if sometimes I don't do it right. Like with Harry and Hermione, I've had my fair share of screw-ups, but at the end of the day, I want to help them and see them safe. Sure, I can get jealous or moody, but it's because I care so much. And when it comes down to it, I'll stick my neck out for them any day, even if it means risking myself. That's what friends are for, right? To have each other's backs, no matter what.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be a bit of a klutz sometimes. Like, there've been times when I've messed up pretty bad, you know? Take that Quidditch match against Slytherin, for example; I was so nervous and everything went haywire. Or when I ran off during the Triwizard Tournament and missed my chance to ask Fleur to the Yule Ball—totally my fault for being such a coward. But hey, I guess that's just part of who I am, right? I'm not perfect, and I do make mistakes, but I always try to make things right when it counts.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, you know, I've faced my share of stress and chaos at Hogwarts. From worrying about Harry being in danger to dealing with the ups and downs of Quidditch and friendships, I've learned that keeping calm isn't always easy. But when things get really tough, I reckon having mates like Harry and Hermione around helps a lot. They give me strength and remind me that we're in this together, no matter what. So, I might not be the most relaxed person, but I do my best to handle it with a bit of humor and a whole lot of loyalty.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there are loads of things that pique my interest, especially when it comes to magic and stuff we can do with our wands. But honestly, some subjects like Divination just leave me cold—I mean, how useful is seeing the future if it’s all a bunch of hocus-pocus? What really gets me going is figuring out new ways to help my friends and make a difference. And, of course, there’s always room for more pranks and magical treats at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes! Who knows what kind of mayhem we can come up with next?

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got more energy than a Niffler on a treasure hunt most days, especially when there's Quidditch involved. But yeah, sometimes it's all a bit overwhelming, you know? Like, one moment I'm cheering for Ireland with all my might, the next I'm blushing and running away after trying to ask a girl out. It's not always easy being the guy who's always ready for an adventure and standing up for what's right. But hey, I've got Harry and Hermione, so we're usually laughing and joking our way through it all, even if there's some serious stuff going down too. Can't let the dark times suck all the fun outta life, right?

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Well, sometimes I do get into arguments, especially if someone's being a right git and saying stuff that really gets under my skin. Like when Malfoy goes off about Hermione or something, it's hard to keep calm. And yeah, I've had my fair share of fallings-out with Harry, mostly because I get jealous or feel like I'm not good enough. But at the end of the day, I don't look for fights; they just kinda find me sometimes. It's all about standing up for what you believe in and who you care about, isn't it? Even if it means getting into a bit of a tangle now and then.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty reliable when it matters most, especially when it comes to helping out mates in a pinch. Like when I played that chess game against McGinnis, or when I risked getting caught by Umbridge to help Harry and Hermione. Sometimes things don't go as planned, though—I mean, who'd've thought a flying car would crash into a tree that likes to beat up vehicles? But overall, I'm there when the chips are down, and that counts for something, doesn't it? Besides, after all we've been through, I think I've got a knack for finding ways to stay on my feet and keep going.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get real tense, especially when something bad happens or when my friends are in danger. It's like that time with Buckbeak and Malfoy, or when Harry went missing into that tunnel, or even during the whole mess with Moody thinking Harry was possessed. Those moments, you know, really test the nerves. But amidst all the worry and the fear, there's always this thing—this bond of friendship—that keeps me going and helps me face whatever comes our way.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't call myself a deep thinker or anything like that. I'm more of a guy who tries to keep things light-hearted and looks out for my mates. But when it comes down to it, I reckon I can think on my feet pretty well. Like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess to get Harry and Hermione through, or distracting Umbridge when Harry needed us to act fast. Sure, I might not have been top of the class, but there's more to being brave than just book smarts, right? And sometimes, a bit of humor and loyalty can light the way forward better than any spell book.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I do generate a fair bit o' enthusiasm, especially when it comes to stuff like Quidditch or standing up for what's right with me mates. Sometimes it gets me into trouble, but hey, where's the fun without a bit o' chaos? And I've learned over the years that a good laugh and being there for each other, that's what really matters.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got a pretty forgiving nature, but it's not like I just bounce back right away. There've been times when I've been real cross with Harry, thinking he was all about his fame and didn't care 'bout me. And then there's Hermione—I've been pretty hard on her too, when I felt she doubted my abilities. But in the end, it's not about forgetting what happened; it's about finding a way to move past it. Friends stick together, even when things get really messy. Like with Lockhart and Ginny, I didn't forget what happened, but I couldn't just leave him there alone. It's tough sometimes, but when you know deep down that someone's got your back, it makes all the difference.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I s'pose you could say I'm a bit messy, especially when things get hectic. I mean, look at my room back at the Burrow—Fred and George would always joke that it was a right state. But when it comes to the important stuff, like keeping an eye out for mates or planning a good old prank, I reckon I can stay pretty organized. It's just... sometimes the little things slip through the cracks, y'know?

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a fair bit, especially when it comes to my friends. Like when Harry went off to face those dragons in the Triwizard Tournament, or when he disappeared into that tunnel, or even when Hermione was brewing that Polyjuice Potion, it's hard not to feel scared. But being there for each other, facing those worries head-on, that's what makes us strong. And honestly, it's not just about the big dangers; sometimes it's the little things too, like Mum trying to keep us from going on adventures. But in the end, it's about sticking together and supporting one another, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do, mate. Think back to the time we brewed up that Polyjuice Potion with Hermione – pretending to be someone else, stepping right into the thick of things, that took a bit o' imagination, didn't it? And then there's those Thestrals Hagrid showed us, creatures only seen by those who've faced death. That's a pretty wild thing to imagine, seeing stuff like that for the first time. But honestly, when it comes down to it, I'm more the guy who'd rather be out flying or having a laugh with mates than sitting around spinning tales all day. Still, in a pinch, a bit of creativity sure can come in handy!

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Not really, mate. I mean, I can be pretty quiet sometimes, especially when things get heavy or when I'm trying to figure something out. But most of the time, I reckon I've got a lot to say, whether it's about Quidditch or standing up for what's right, or even just banter with Harry. It's just, you know, there are times when silence feels like the best thing, especially when the world around us is going mad. But don't let that fool you—I'm always thinking a mile a minute, even when I'm not talking.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: I reckon I can be trusting, but I've had my fair share of moments where I doubted my friends, especially when things got tough and fame started to affect how we all acted. I've learned that loyalty and friendship are worth fighting for, even if sometimes it feels like you're facing your own doubts. But in the end, it’s those who stick by you, like Harry and Hermione did, through thick and thin, that you realize you can count on.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I suppose like anyone else, there've been times when I'd rather just sit back and relax instead of diving into some homework or a chore. But when it comes to what really matters—like standing up for my friends or facing down dark wizards—I'm not one to shy away. I might have my doubts sometimes, especially about myself, but at the end of the day, I reckon there's nothing lazier than turning your back on those you care about in their time of need.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I reckon it depends on what you call "emotionally stable." I've had my moments where things get to me, like when my sister started dating Dean Thomas or when Harry thought I was spying on him. Those weren't exactly the most chill times. But when it comes down to it, and there's real trouble brewing, I usually manage to hold it together and do what needs to be done. I mean, watching Harry take on dragons in the Triwizard Tournament or seeing him come back after that business with Cedric Diggory, well, that was scary stuff, but I didn't let it stop me from being there for him. So, I guess you could say I'm pretty steady when it counts, even if I do have a bit of a temper.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more of a follower than a leader when it comes to inventions. Leave that to the likes of my twin brothers, Fred and George. They're the ones who come up with all sorts of crazy stuff for their joke shop. But hey, I've had my fair share of quick thinking, especially in the heat of the moment. Like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard’s Chess to save the day. So, while I might not be the one whipping up Polyjuice Potion or inventing new flavors of sweets, I do know how to use what’s at hand to help out my mates when it really matters. And let’s not forget, sometimes just being there and figuring out how to use what you’ve got can make all the difference in the world.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty assertive when it really matters. Like when I sacrificed myself in that chess game to save us all, or standing up to Harry when I thought things weren't right—even if that didn’t go down well. But usually, I’m more about sticking up for my mates and doing whatever it takes to keep us together. Sometimes that means stepping back and letting Harry or Hermione take the lead, but when it comes down to it, I’m right there ready to fight, no matter how scared I might be inside. It's just... sometimes folks underestimate me, and that can sting. But hey, I guess that's okay as long as I know how much I mean to the people who really matter.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be pretty cold and aloof when things get tough, I guess. Like when I thought Harry was pushing me away because he liked being famous more than hanging out with us, I just sort of shut down and got mad at him. And there was that time with Hermione after the holidays, where she ignored me so much that it felt like a knife twisting in my gut. But those moments don't last long—I'm all about keeping friends close and family happy, no matter how much I might mess up along the way. In the end, I always come back to what really matters.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do, especially when it comes to sticking with me mates through thick and thin. There’ve been times where I’ve felt right terrified, like entering that bloody spider-infested forest or chasing after Harry to the Department of Mysteries, but in the end, I always push through. It’s not just about finishing a task; it’s about being there for each other, no matter what. Even if things get real hairy or my nerves are shot, I try to hold on to that courage and see it through, for Harry, Hermione, and all the others. After all, we’re in this together, and that’s what matters most.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Yeah, I can be pretty moody, alright? Just ask Harry and Hermione—they've seen me go from grumpy to downright angry more times than they probably care to remember. And let's not forget those times when everything just feels kinda heavy, like after Hagrid got hurt or when Ginny started seeing Dean. But you know, in the end, it's the people who stick around during those moments who really matter. Friends and family—they're what pull me back when I'm wandering off into my own head.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do appreciate a good bit of artistry and aesthetics, but it’s not exactly what you’d call my strong suit. I’m more the kind who values a laugh and a good game of Quidditch. But hey, when I see something really magical, like the way George and the twins make people smile with their jokes, or even that strange platter we came up with that looks all eerie but tastes fresh, it does give me a moment of pause and makes me think, "Wow, that's brilliant." So yeah, I can see the appeal in that sort of thing, especially when it brings a bit of joy to folks.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get real shy sometimes, especially when it comes to talking to people I fancy or just plain new folks. Like that time I tried to ask Fleur Delacour out on the train, my ears went all hot and I couldn't even look her in the eye. But once I'm with Harry and Hermione, or my family, it's like everything else fades away and I'm just me—impulsive and loyal, but still kinda clumsy with the big feelings stuff. It's a bit of a curse and a blessing, really. Helps keep me grounded, I suppose.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try to be, mate. But let's be honest, there've been times when I've let my temper get the better of me, especially with Harry back in the day. I mean, who wouldn't feel a bit jealous of him, right? And then there's Hermione—I've said some stuff I didn't mean when I was feeling down or unsure of myself. But at the end of the day, I'm loyal to a fault and I'll always be there to stand up for what's right, for my mates. That's what matters most, isn't it?

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more the type to dive straight into things than to plan them out perfectly first. Sometimes I find myself in a right mess because of it, but hey, when it comes to saving the day or helping my mates, I usually manage to get us through one way or another. It's not always the most efficient method, but it works, and that's what counts, right? Besides, with Hermione around to keep us on track and Harry to think up the brilliant plans, we usually come out alright in the end.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, let me think about that... I've got to admit, I'm more of the type who gets a bit twitchy and maybe even a tad explosive when things get tense. But when it comes down to it, I guess my biggest strength is sticking by my mates, no matter how chaotic or dangerous things get. I mean, I’ve been there for Harry through some seriously dark times, even when I felt like I was about to lose it myself. So yeah, I might not be the calmest bloke around, but I’m loyal until the bitter end. And if a good laugh or a cheeky comment can lighten the mood, well, you know, I’m always up for that.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Nah, that's not really my thing. I mean, I guess there's a certain comfort in knowing what's coming next, but it'd probably drive me mad. I'm more the type who likes a bit of adventure, y'know? It's all about the unexpected, keeping things exciting. Besides, with my past, sitting still and doing the same old stuff every day wouldn't sit well with me. Gives me too much time to think, and trust me, that's not always a good thing. But hey, when you've got friends by your side, you can face any challenge that comes your way, right?

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty sociable when I want to be, especially with me mates. But there've been times when I've felt kinda left out, y'know? Like when Harry's fame was getting bigger than us, or when I got mad at Ginny for that kiss. It's like I can switch from being all smiles and jokes to turning right cold on ya, depending on how I'm feeling. And sometimes, it's just easier to let the others take the lead, while I sort things out in my head. But deep down, I care a lot about the people around me, and I'll always be there for them, even if I don't say it much.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Yeah, I've been known to snap at people every now and then, especially when things aren't going my way. Like that time my wand kept turning into slugs instead of curses—I was pretty grumpy and probably wasn’t too polite to anyone who crossed my path. And there was that bit with Harry during our second year, when I got all jealous and distant. I know I can come off as a bit rough around the edges, but it’s usually because I’m worried about the people I care about or feeling left out. But you know, loyalty always wins out in the end, and I make sure to apologize when I realize I’ve been a git.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Plans? Yeah, I've made a few, but let's face it, things at Hogwarts never really went according to plan, did they? One minute I'm trying to think up some clever scheme to get past a teacher or figure out how to help Harry and Hermione, and the next minute there's a giant three-headed dog or a crazy professor messing everything up. Still, when it comes down to it, I stick with my friends and see it through, even if we're running down tunnels or battling dark wizards. That's the real deal, right? Loyalty over all, mate.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily, especially before big stuff like Quidditch matches or when we're planning some crazy plan to save someone. But when it comes down to it, I think my friends keep me going. Knowing Harry and Hermione have my back, well, it's like having a shield. It doesn't mean I'm not scared, but it helps a lot. And sometimes, it's that fear that pushes me to do things I never thought I could. Like helping Harry escape the Dursleys or facing off with all sorts of dark stuff. I guess I can say I'm not fearless, but I've got a bunch of mates who make me feel like I can face anything.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there’s times when I do like to mull things over, especially when it comes to chess or a new prank we could pull at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes with George. But let’s be honest, I’m more of a guy who acts first and thinks later. I’ve learned that sometimes, you just gotta make a move, even if it means sacrificing yourself for your mates, ya know? And yeah, I’ve seen Hermione dive deep into ideas and books, which is kinda amazing and scary all at once. So, while I might not spend all my time pondering, I do appreciate when a good idea comes my way, especially if it helps keep my friends safe and makes us laugh along the way.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got more interest in a nice game of Quidditch than in any fancy art stuff. I mean, there's something magical about watching a Quaffle soar through the air or dodging Bludgers, isn't there? But, hey, I'm all for trying new things if it means spending time with friends and having a good laugh. Just don't expect me to pick up a paintbrush anytime soon; I think I'll leave that to someone else while I focus on the Wheezes and maybe some broomstick tinkering. That's more my style, really.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon cooperation's pretty important, especially when you're facing stuff like dark wizards and dangerous creatures. It's not just about winning a game or a cup—it's about having mates you can trust and who've got your back. Like when we saved Buckbeak or helped Harry through the Triwizard Tournament, we couldn't have done that alone. Working together, we manage to do some pretty amazing things, even if I do say so myself. And yeah, sometimes it's not easy—there's a lot of arguments and jealousies along the way—but in the end, it's always worth it. Friendship and teamwork can get you through anything, you know?

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, you'd have to say I am, especially when there's something more interesting going on around me than what I'm supposed to be doing. Like that time my wand kept backfiring, turning a simple spell into a slug-fest. But you know, distractions aren't always bad—they can be pretty funny sometimes. It's just that when things get serious, like when it really matters, I've learned to focus. And hey, I might lose it a bit now and then, but I've got friends who keep me grounded, even if it means getting annoyed at me every once in a while.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I'm more the type to fancy a good game of Quidditch or a laugh with my mates than get lost in a painting or a book. Don't get me wrong, there's plenty of magic in those things, but it's not exactly where I shine brightest. I guess when it comes down to it, I'm more about the real stuff—like standing up for what's right, even if it means facing some pretty tough odds. But hey, I do have a bit of a knack for coming up with dodgy plans, which might count for something in our line of work!
